wikipedia_page.main: Sir Frederick Hindle (28 July 1877 – 23 April 1953) was a Liberal Party politician in the United Kingdom, who served as Member of Parliament (MP) for the Darwen constituency in Lancashire in the short 1910 parliament and from 1923 to 1924.

response: Hindle was the son of John Hindle and Alice Chadwick. He was educated at Blackburn Grammar School. Senior Prizeman at Examination as Solicitor in 1870. In 1876 he married Helen Moulden Gillibrand. They had one son, Frederick Hindle, jun., who was also Liberal MP for Darwen.(2007, December 01). Hindle, Frederick George, (15 Jan. 1848–1 March 1925), solicitor; Clerk to Darwen Borough Justices since 1882; MP (L) Darwen Division of Lancashire, Jan.–Dec. 1910. WHO'S WHO & WHO WAS WHO. Ed.
